page.title: 16Education
page.content:
Camblesforth County Primary School.
I have attended Camblesforth C.P.School for 3 years. The Headteacher is Mr Scott who teaches first and second year Juniors. The Deputy Head is Mr Smit who teaches the largest class of 34 third and fourth year Juniors. The Infants are taught by Mrs Kell and Mrs Hill. Mrs Sykes is our part-time teacher and is at school for 9 hours a week. The school has about 100 pupils aged from 4 to 11. School starts at 9.00 and ends at 3.15 for the Infants and 3.45 for the Juniors. There are various activities in school : computer, recorders, gymnastics, guitar, book club, football, netball, cricket, athletics. The school has a very supportive Parent Teachers Association which helps provide money for the school.
